text:
Hi - Has anyone familiar with Google Analytics been able to recreate HubSpot traffic sources as “channels” in Google Analytics?

With google’s default channel definitions Organic and Paid social are attribute to the “other” channel

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/understand-HubSpots-traffic-sources-in-the-traffic-analytics-tool|This article details the HubSpot traffic categorisation>

<https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/3297892?hl=en|Google default channel definitions>

Thanks
Hey there <@U01TMTTS6JG> , I’d suggest asking in <#CJ5DN6RKP|email-development> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs>.
Hey Aleksander, would you be able to DM me your support ticket ID Number? I’ll see what i can find out on my end for you.

*Hi there :)*
Im facing an issue with HubSpot script inside of react app, and wondering if someone here could help…
In short: I have react app, with HubSpot script embedded inside the index.js file. 
I can see the script itself when running the app in the browser, 
Since react is a single-page app, the source code inside of the index.html will be fired only once, in the initial rendering of the app, meaning when the user visit the first URL inside the app, and not when navigating to any other pages inside the app.
The problem that it causes is that leads go in HubSpot only if the user fill this input in the first page he visits. 

For example, a user visit <http://joonko.co|joonko.co> and submitting a form - the leads go into HubSpot.
But if the case is: a user visit <http://joonko.co|joonko.co> and then navigating to <http://joonko.co/talent-stream|joonko.co/talent-stream> and only then submitting a form - the leads will not go into HubSpot

Really important to note - we are using history.push (react-router-dom) to navigate between pages.
